intro: Colutia rubra, commonly known as red sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cistaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas or inland deserts. Colutia rubra is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
